1.q_string: A body of mass 1 kg is projected with velocity 40 m/s at an angle of projection 30° with the horizontal. The magnitude of change in momentum from t = 0 to t=2 sec is:

A body is projected at time \(t=0\) from a certain point on a planet and surface with a certain velocity at a certain angle with the planet and surface (assumed horizontal). The horizontal and vertical displacements \(x\) and \(y\) (in metres), respectively vary with time \(t\) (in seconds) as \(x=10 \sqrt{3} t\) and \(y=10 t-t^{2}\). What is the value of acceleration due to the gravity on the planet and surface?

q_option: \(20 ms ^{-1}\) at an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) with the horizontal
\(20 ms ^{-1}\) at an angle of \(60^{\circ}\) with the horizontal
\(10 ms ^{-1}\) at an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) with the horizontal
\(10 ms ^{-1}\) at an angle of \(60^{\circ}\) with the horizontal
1.q_string:
A body is projected at time \(t=0\) from a certain point on a planet's surface with a certain velocity at a certain angle with the planet's surface (assumed horizontal). The horizontal and vertical displacements \(x\) and \(y\) (in metres), respectively vary with time \(t\) (in seconds) as \(x=10 \sqrt{3} t\) and \(y=10 t-t^{2}\).

What is the magnitude and direction of the velocity with which the body is projected?

A stone weighing \(0.5 Kg\) tied to a rope of length \(0.5 m\) revolves along a circular path in a vertical plane. The tension of the rope at the bottom point of the circle is \(45 N\). To what height will the stone rise if the rope breaks the moment the velocity is directed upwards? \(\left( g =10 m / s ^{2}\right)\)
A body of mass \(0.4 kg\) is whirled in a vertical circle making \(2 rev / s\). If the radius of the circle is \(1.2 m\), then the tension in the string when the body is at the top of the circle is:

A cyclist starts from the centre \(O\) of a circular track of radius \(r=1 km\) reaches the edge \(P\) of the track, cycles along the circumference and stops at point \(Q\) as shown in the figure below. If the total time taken is \(10\) minutes, what is the average velocity of the cyclist?

A cyclist starts from the centre 'O' of a circular park of radius \(1 km\), reaches the edge 'P' of the park, then cycles along the circumference and returns to the centre along 'QO' as shown in the figure. If the round trip takes \(10 min\), the net displacement and average speed of the cyclist respectively (in \(m\) and \(km/hr\)) are:

A projectile thrown at an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) with the horizontal has a range \(R _{1}\) and attains a maximum height \(h _{1}\). Another projectile is thrown, with the same velocity, at an angle \(30^{\circ}\) with the vertical, has a range \(R _{2}\) and attains a maximum height \(h _{2}\), what is the relation between \(h _{1}\) and \(h _{2}\)?

The radius of a curved road on National Highway is \(R\). The width of the road is \(b\). The outer edge of the road is raised by \(h\) with respect to the inner edge, so that a car with velocity \(v\) can pass safely over it. The value of \(h\) is:
A large number of bullets are fired in all directions with the same speed \(ν\). What is the maximum area of spread of the bullets?

A projectile thrown at an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) with the horizontal has a range \(R _{1}\) and attains a maximum height \(h _{1}\). Another projectile is thrown, with the same velocity, at an angle \(30^{\circ}\) with the vertical, has a range \(R _{2}\) and attains a maximum height \(h _{2}\).

The relation between \(R _{1}\) and \(R _{2}\) is

q_option: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true and Statement - 2 is the correct explanation for Statement - 1.
Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true, but Statement - 2 is NOT the correct explanation for Statement - 1.
Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is false.
Statement - 1 is false, Statement - 2 is true.
1.q_string:
Directions: In the following question, Statement - 1 (Assertion) is followed by Statement - 2 (Reason). The question has the following four options, out of which only ONE choice is correct.

Statement - 1: The maximum range on an inclined plane when a body is projected upwards from the base of the plane is less than that when it is projected downwards from the top of the same plane with the same speed.

Statement - 2: The maximum range along an inclined plane is independent of the angle of inclination of the plane.

A balloon is rising vertically upwards at a velocity of \(10 ms ^{-1}\). When it is at a height of \(45 m\) from the ground, a parachutist bails out from it. After \(3 s\), he opens his parachute and decelerates at a constant rate of \(5 ms ^{-2}\). What was the height of the parachutist above the ground when he opened his parachute? Take \(g =10 ms ^{-2}\).

A cannon on a level plain is aimed at an angle \(\alpha\) above the horizontal and a shell is fired with a muzzle velocity \(v _{0}\) towards a vertical cliff, a distance \(R\) away. The height from the bottom at which the shell strikes the side walls of the cliff is:

Two particles starting from a point on a circle of radius \(4 m\) in a horizontal plane move along the circle in opposite directions with constant speeds of \(4 ms ^{-1}\) and \(6 ms ^{-1}\). The particles will collide with each other in:
